column4: any idea why I get a duplicate eth2 with default settings after I reboot?
Nope... eth0, eth1 and eth2.  a second eth2 is picked up on boot each time and I need to delete it.
Maybe it's some internal hardware that Ubuntu is getting confused about
Or maybe it goes "wireless, wired ethernet, modem"?
No idea.... thus my presence here.  :)
ls /dev | grep eth | less and pastebin the results.
So, when it tries to list the contents of /dev, no eth devices appear...
Either something's VERY wrong or it wants root access...try with sudo
One thing to note is I did an upgrade from 8.04 to 8.10.  A few others were complaining of this duplicate interface issue too.
Ah. I should probably check to see if it happened to me
I'm in /dev , see nothing related to ethX.
I think so...   see what you get with an ifconfig
Yep, eth0 is showing up fine
